question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In this scenario, we are evaluating the probabilities of various events related to Elon Musk's attendance and statements regarding Bitcoin at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 conference. The events are interconnected; for instance, if Elon Musk shows up at the conference (P), it may influence whether he makes a public statement about Bitcoin (Q). However, both events can occur independently, and thus we need to carefully assess their probabilities.

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up)**: I estimate a probability of 0.60 for this event based on Musk's past engagements and the significance of the event.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up)**: This would be the complement of P, calculated as 1 - P, giving us a probability of 0.40.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend)**: This is essentially the same as P, so I estimate it to also be 0.60.

4. **Q (Elon Musk makes a public statement about Bitcoin)**: Given Musk's active engagement with Bitcoin, I estimate a probability of 0.70 that he will make a statement at some event in 2024.

5. **P_and_Q (Both P and Q occur)**: This is a joint probability that both events happen. Assuming some correlation, I estimate this at 0.50.

6. **P_or_Q (Either P or Q occurs)**: This is calculated using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q. Using the previous estimates, I calculate this to be 0.80.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurs and not P occurs)**: This probability would be lower since it involves the occurrence of Q without P. I estimate this at 0.20.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurs given P occurs)**: This conditional probability can be estimated based on the correlation between P and Q. I estimate it at 0.75.

Overall, the estimates need to comply with the consistency rules, ensuring that probabilities are logically coherent. For example, the sum of probabilities for complementary events (P and not_P) should equal 1, and the calculations for joint and conditional probabilities must align with the established relationships.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. or Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Donald Trump Jr. or Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In evaluating the probability estimates for the provided questions regarding Elon Musk's participation in the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and his public statements about Bitcoin, I considered several factors. 

1. **P (Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: Given Musk's high-profile nature and past involvement in Bitcoin discussions, I estimate a moderate-to-high probability that he will attend the event. 

2. **not_P (Will Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This is the complement of P, and thus, its probability will be adjusted accordingly based on the estimate for P. 

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This is a similar question to P, and I expect it to have a probability close to P, but slightly higher, as 'possible' implies a broader scope of potential attendance. 

4. **Q (Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?)**: Considering Musk's active engagement with Bitcoin, I expect a reasonable probability that he will make a statement at some event in 2024, independent of his attendance at the Nashville event. 

5. **P_and_Q (Will both P and Q occur?)**: This probability is expected to be lower than both P and Q, as it requires both events to happen simultaneously. 

6. **P_or_Q (Will either P or Q occur?)**: This probability should be higher than either P or Q alone, reflecting the likelihood that at least one of the events will happen. 

7. **Q_and_not_P (Will both Q occur and not P occur?)**: This scenario requires that Musk makes a public statement but does not attend the Nashville event, which I expect to have a lower probability than Q alone. 

8. **Q_given_P (Given P occurs, will Q occur?)**: This conditional probability may be higher than Q alone since if Musk attends the Nashville event, he may be more likely to make a public statement about Bitcoin. 

In terms of consistency, I ensured that the probabilities adhere to the mathematical rules provided. Specifically, the relationships between P, not_P, Q, and the combinations of these events (e.g., P_and_Q, P_or_Q) must align with the defined consistency rules.
